Description: Windows Server 2008 R2 - is the first operating system is Windows, 
which will only support 64-bit processors. 
Currently, Windows Server 2008 R2 supports up to 256 logical processor cores for a 
single instance of the operating system and hypervisor Hyper-V allows you to use up to 64 logical 
cores for virtualization. This not only allows more efficient use of server hardware, 
but also improves reliability, reducing the number of locks and increasing the level of parallelism.
